intro: Hieracium annae-toutoniae subsp. annae-toutoniae, commonly known as the Toutonias' hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rosette growth habit and produces yellow flowers with ray florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring rocky and well-drained soils. It is native to the Pyrenees and has a limited distribution. Due to its restricted range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
